<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Re-assemble i64 arguments split up in SelectionDAGBuilder&#39;s</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Note: This function was copied from, and is essentially identical</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to ARMISelDAGToDAG::SelectInlineAsm. It is very unfortunate that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// such hacking-up is necessary; a rethink of how inline asm operands</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// are handled may be in order to make doing this more sane.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// TODO: fix inline asm support so I can simply tell it that &#39;i64&#39;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// inputs to asm need to be allocated to the IntPair register type,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and have that work. Then, delete this function.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SparcDAGToDAGISel::tryInlineAsm(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdnode">SDNode</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>)&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::vector&lt;SDValue&gt; AsmNodeOperands;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#a536e22898d28a9340a4204407a75ad5d">NumOps</a> = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>-&gt;getNumOperands();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Normally, i64 data is bounded to two arbitrary GPRs for &quot;%r&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// constraint.  However, some instructions (e.g. ldd/std) require</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (even/even+1) GPRs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// So, here, we check for this case, and mutate the inlineasm to use</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// a single IntPair register instead, which guarantees such even/odd</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// placement.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For Kind  == InlineAsm::Kind::RegUse, we first copy two GPRs into a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// GPRPair and then pass the GPRPair to the inline asm.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-loadstorevectorizer-cpp-/#afd1adfcbfce320e6265935ce4d6299a3">Chain</a> = AsmNodeOperands&#91;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/inlineasm/#af263df97504e0800bba5e552246b7370a561c23f9fc6d8fe79f70cebf74937b30">InlineAsm::Op&#95;InputChain</a>&#93;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> T0 = CurDAG-&gt;getCopyFromReg(Chain, dl, Reg0, MVT::i32,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                          <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-loadstorevectorizer-cpp-/#afd1adfcbfce320e6265935ce4d6299a3">Chain</a>.getValue(1));</span></CodeLine>
